org.usfirst.frc.team1736.lib.Sensors

Class L3G4200DGyro

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.usfirst.frc.team1736.lib.Sensors.L3G4200DGyro

  • public class L3G4200DGyro
extends java.lang.Object
    DESCRIPTION:
    Driver for L3G4200D MEMS Gyro Includes filtering and discrete integral for angle calculation.
    Multithreaded support. Initializing the gyro kicks off a periodic read function which asynchronously reads from they gyro in the background.
    The periodic update function is designed to be called by this background thread. Each time it is called, it gets the latest value from the gyro, performs any filtering required, and integrates the gyro value to calculate an angle. Class-private variables are updated by this function.
    USAGE:
    1. Instantiate class. This will start periodic reads and calcualtions in the background.
    2. Set Threshold and dbnc (time) globals
    3. When needed, call the read methods to get the most recent angle or rotational rate reading from the sensor.

        Number of reads to do on init
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • zero_motion_offset

        public short zero_motion_offset
        Nominal Z value. This is populated at startup with the average value of all the reads we take from the gyro.

        public static final double gyro_deadzone
        Minimum rotational speed to start accumulating rotation

    • Method Detail

      • get_gyro_z

        public double get_gyro_z()
        Returns:
        The most recent gyro reading in degrees per second.

      • get_gyro_angle

        public double get_gyro_angle()
        Get the most recent angle calculation result from the gyro. Angle can vary between -Infinity and Infinity, you must wrap this to 0-360 if desired.
        Returns:
        The most recently calculated gyro angle in degrees

      • reset_gyro_angle

        public void reset_gyro_angle()
        Resets the current angle of the gyro to zero

      • get_gyro_read_status

        public boolean get_gyro_read_status()
        Check if the most recent read from the gyro was good or not.
        Returns:
        True if gyro is reading good data, false if gyro data is corrupted.

      • get_gyro_initalized

        public boolean get_gyro_initalized()
        Check if the gyro has been initalized fully yet or not.
        Returns:
        True if gyro is initalized, false if not.
